revision.text:
{{lowercase title}} {{WPAVIATION|class=start|Rotorcraft=yes|b1=y|b2=y|b3=y|b4=y|b5=y}} {{WPMILHIST|class=B|B1=y|B2=y|B3=y|B4=y|B5=y|Aviation=yes|US=yes}} {{dyktalk|17 May|2010|entry=... that [[Thomas Edison]] hailed '''[[George de Bothezat]]''''s rotorcraft, the "'''[[de Bothezat helicopter|Flying Octopus]]'''", as "the first successful [[helicopter]]"?}}
==Co-designer==
* Leishman, Gordon J (2006). [http://books.google.com/books?id=nMV-TkaX-9cC Principles of helicopter aerodynamics]. Cambridge University Press. ISBN 0521858607. pp. 25-26
says that machine had a co-designer, someone Ivan Jerome, and then calls their contraption "Jerome-de Bothezat quadrotor or the "Flying Octopus"". This might be worth more research; I'm not sure how it can be integrated in the article as it stands now. [[User:East of Borschov|East of Borschov]] ([[User talk:East of Borschov|talk]]) 07:43, 10 May 2010 (UTC) :Thanks for finding that! I noticed one mention of Ivan in my books. I think I know how to work that in... - [[User:The Bushranger|The Bushranger]] <sub>[[User talk:The Bushranger|Return fire]]</sub><small><sup>[[User:The Bushranger/Pages Created|''Flank speed'']]</sup></small> 13:50, 10 May 2010 (UTC)
FYI, I put together [[George de Bothezat]]. Quite a colourful chap. [[User:East of Borschov|East of Borschov]] ([[User talk:East of Borschov|talk]]) 16:37, 10 May 2010 (UTC) :Quite so. Great work, too! I've added your article to the DYK hook for this one. :) - [[User:The Bushranger|The Bushranger]] <sub>[[User talk:The Bushranger|Return fire]]</sub><small><sup>[[User:The Bushranger/Pages Created|''Flank speed'']]</sup></small> 03:34, 11 May 2010 (UTC)
== Not to cast aspersions on the sources but ==
I'm not aware of any Le Rhone radials, only the rotaries. Do the sources give any particulars as to number of cylinders etc? [[User:GraemeLeggett|GraemeLeggett]] ([[User talk:GraemeLeggett|talk]]) 14:05, 17 May 2010 (UTC) :Hm. I wondered about that. What I saw described the 180hp engine as "radial" - perhaps it was a Gnome-Rhône instead of a Le Rhône? Or maybe it was simply one of those errors that gets passed around. I'll see what I can dig up. (Thanks for the ''Flight'' link, BTW!) - [[User:The Bushranger|The Bushranger]] <sub>[[User talk:The Bushranger|Return fire]]</sub><small><sup>[[User:The Bushranger/Pages Created|''Flank speed'']]</sup></small> 14:33, 17 May 2010 (UTC) ::Flight says 170 hp Le-Rhône, not saying rotary or radial. The Le-Rhòne 9R seems to fit the bill.[[User:TSRL|TSRL]] ([[User talk:TSRL|talk]]) 17:29, 18 May 2014 (UTC)
== External links modified ==
Hello fellow Wikipedians,
I have just added archive links to {{plural:1|one external link|1 external links}} on [[De Bothezat helicopter]]. Please take a moment to review [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=prev&oldid=706801530 my edit]. If necessary, add {{tlx|cbignore}} after the link to keep me from modifying it. Alternatively, you can add {{tlx|nobots|deny{{=}}InternetArchiveBot}} to keep me off the page altogether. I made the following changes: *Added archive https://web.archive.org/20140220014341/http://www.centennialofflight.net/essay/Rotary/early_20th_century/HE2.htm to http://www.centennialofflight.net/essay/Rotary/early_20th_century/HE2.htm
When you have finished reviewing my changes, please set the ''checked'' parameter below to '''true''' to let others know.
{{sourcecheck|checked=true}}
Cheers.—[[User:Cyberbot II|<sup style="color:green;font-family:Courier">cyberbot II]]<small><sub style="margin-left:-14.9ex;color:green;font-family:Comic Sans MS">[[User talk:Cyberbot II|<span style="color:green">Talk to my owner]]:Online</sub></small> 10:37, 25 February 2016 (UTC) :{{Checked}} - [[User:Ahunt|Ahunt]] ([[User talk:Ahunt|talk]]) 03:18, 26 February 2016 (UTC)
